snippet: The project’s future has fallen on the shoulders of two high-profile politicians who aspire to become the city’s next mayor.
abstract: New York University proposal to erect four buildings north of Houston Street, perhaps the largest project ever proposed for Greenwich Village, faces fierce opposition from area residents who fear the destruction of one of New York City's signature neighborhoods; project’s future has fallen on the shoulders of two high-profile politicians, Christine C Quinn and Scott M Stringer, who both aspire to become the city’s next mayor.
lead_paragraph: The project’s future has fallen on the shoulders of two high-profile politicians who aspire to become the city’s next mayor.

headline.seo: N.Y.U. Expansion Plan Upsets Some Greenwich Village Neighbors
headline.main: N.Y.U.’s Plan for Expansion Draws Anger in Community
headline.print_headline: N.Y.U.’s Plan For Expansion Draws Anger In Community
